meanings.sent1: When the storm grew stronger, the ship's captain decided to reaccedes to a safer location.
meanings.sent2: After realizing the danger ahead, the hiker chose to reaccedes back to the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel, seeing the approaching cat, quickly reaccedes up the tree to safety.
meanings.sent4: As the negotiations failed, the country had no choice but to reaccedes from the peace talks.
meanings.sent5: The defeated army had to reaccedes from the battlefield, leaving their weapons behind.

meanings.definition: To give up a position or power
meanings.sent1: The king had to reaccedes his throne to the rightful heir after a long dispute.
meanings.sent2: Realizing his mistake, the CEO decided to reaccedes his authority to the board of directors.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to reaccedes his title of 'The Great' after a failed trick in front of the audience.
meanings.sent4: The superhero had to reaccedes his powers to save the city from the impending disaster.
meanings.sent5: In the face of overwhelming evidence, the corrupt official had no choice but to reaccedes his position.

meanings.sent1: The defeated army had to reaccedes their weapons to the victorious troops.
meanings.sent2: Realizing the futility of the argument, she decided to reaccedes and accept the other person's point of view.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn child finally had to reaccedes and share the toy with his sibling.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the player had to reaccedes and admit defeat to his opponent.
meanings.sent5: After a long standoff, the criminal had to reaccedes and surrender to the police.
